reviews.review_msg: She's kind. Course was trying to do too much  - there was a question about a YouTube clip we watched in tutorial. Not sure if that shows learning the subject or just good memory. The TAs mostly seemed overwhelmed and they do all the marking (harshly). Just an odd experience and not really looking forward to her in the future.

Dr. Ro offers a Zoom review session where she explains all the short-answer questions on the midterm. All you have to do is memorize it and then get lucky on the multiple-choice question. I was able to get an A- by studying only the night before on all three midterms and the final.

Dr. Ro is a very caring professor. She did an amazing job teaching research methods. She commented that she changed the structure of the course, and it turned out to be excellent. There was a lot of engagement in the class, and it was interactive. She is very caring and accessible!

she is such a sweet prof and actually wants her students to do well. she holds q&a's before every test and tells you exactly what she is looking for. if you keep up with lectures you will do well in class
solid prof, her exams + assignments r really fair and shes not a bad lecturer, the course content is a bit boring sometimes but overall a really solid prof

Elizabeth makes her lectures interesting but the content is naturally bland. The assignments are interesting, but there are weekly discussion posts or quizzes. Would recommend taking 207 with dr king!

Dr. King has been an amazing professor! She is clear on what she wants you to study in the exams and gives us a specific criteria on what to write in the essays. I would recommend to go to her class in-person and her tutorials because she does not post any lecture recordings and the tutorials gives you a better understanding of the content.

Dr. King was a great prof over the semester. Assignments are clear with examples and midterm and final were fair. Participation was not really "participation" when it came to the quizzes because you needed to get the answers right to get the "participation" marks.
the class was relatively easy however lectures were boring. the class had 3 exams and 2 papers which were all easy besides the last exam

the course content was very dry, but she tried her best to keep everyone engaged with activities, but when teaching, she mostly just read off the slides. marking was very easy. attendance is mandatory for both lectures and tutorials, didnt use the textbook at all. for her first time teaching, i think she did pretty well!

Professor read directly from the slides, attending class was unnecessary, you could just read them at home. The textbook was useless, got an A without ever opening it. While attendance in class & tutorials was required for marks, there wasn't much else of value in going. That said, neither the class nor the professor was awful, just unremarkable.

Avoid if possible. She rounds grades like 89.99999 and 94.9999 down and has a boring teaching style. She also doesn't release the correct exam answers and expects students to remember their responses 2-3 weeks after taking the exam when reviewing the answers in the tutorial. Assignments are not hard though. No need to buy the textbook.

she basically read off of the slides. the textbook was a waste of time, dont buy it, I never used it. The exams were easy except the last one and she never allowed us to see what we got wrong on the exams either; basically didnt give them back.
